title: Textile, early 20th century
medium:
Medium: wool, camel hair (?), cotton
Technique: weft-faced plain weave with supplementary weft patterning
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 223 x 137 cm (7 ft. 3 13/16 in. x 53 15/16 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mrs Calvin W. Stillman
description: Blanket or rug composed of six narrow bands sewn together, with a braided cord attached on two sides. Discrete bands of black, rust-red, and white brocaded with small triangles and bars in black, and tapestry bands in rust-red, yellow, and white, on a white ground.
